body_html:
A SparseTensor is just three tensorflow Tensors (indices, values, and shape). Ops which take or produce SparseTensor are just python wrappers around tf ops which pass/return these 3 tensors.
…

I think the function passed to tf.py_func is purely "numpy", so there must be a sparse object type in numpy that we can convert tf.SparseTensor to. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body:
A SparseTensor is just three tensorflow Tensors (indices, values, and
shape). Ops which take or produce SparseTensor are just python wrappers
around tf ops which pass/return these 3 tensors.

On Thu, May 18, 2017 at 11:28 PM, Ziming Dong <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> "numpy", so there must be a sparse object type in numpy that we can convert
> tf.SparseTensor to.
